metadata.title: Infl uenza Virus Infection in Nonhuman Primates

abstract.original_text: To determine whether nonhuman primates are infected with infl uenza viruses in nature, we conducted serologic and swab studies among macaques from several parts of the world. Our detection of infl uenza virus and antibodies to infl uenza virus raises questions about the role of nonhuman primates in the ecology of infl uenza.

sentences.segment_text: To determine whether nonhuman primates are infected with infl uenza viruses in nature ,
we conducted serologic and swab studies among macaques from several parts of the world .
Our detection of infl uenza virus and antibodies to infl uenza virus raises questions about the role of nonhuman primates in the ecology of infl uenza .
